subject: Raise premature exceptions that happen before switch role
commit_message:
Raise premature exceptions that happen before switch role

Currently, the following bad scenarios are possible:

1) Forbidden expected, Forbidden thrown prematurely

    @rbac_rule_validation.action(
        service="nova",
        rule="os_compute_api:os-agents")
    def test_list_agents_rbac(self):
        # During test set up, a Forbidden exception is raised
        self.rbac_utils.switch_role(self, toggle_rbac_role=True)
        self.agents_client.list_agents()

What should happen: The Forbidden is raised by the test
and results in test failure.
What actually happens: The Forbidden exception is treated
as a test success.

2) NotFound expected, NotFound thrown prematurely

    @rbac_rule_validation.action(
        service="nova",
        rule="os_compute_api:os-agents",
         expected_error_code=404)
    def test_list_agents_rbac(self):
        # During test set up, a NotFound exception is raised
        self.rbac_utils.switch_role(self, toggle_rbac_role=True)
        self.agents_client.list_agents()

What should happen: The NotFound is raised by the test and
results in test failure.
What actually happens: The NotFound exception is treated
as a test success.

Validation should be added to prevent either case from happening.
Patrole should only validate that the exception raised following
switch_role is the expected one -- any exceptions
(except for skipException) raised before switch_role should result
in an error and test failure because that is a result of bad setup.

This commit:
  * adds validation to prevent premature exception matching
    expected_error_code to result in false positive
  * refactors unit tests
  * adds/updates docstrings and updates a few comments in
    rbac_utils

subject: dvr: Move normal/output br-int flows to table TRANSIENT
commit_message:
dvr: Move normal/output br-int flows to table TRANSIENT

DVR flows are not compatible with OVS firewall flows as firewall flows
have higher priority. As a consequence, rules for DVR were never match
as firewall uses output directly.

This patch replaces flows using normal or output actions and resends
packets to TRANSIENT table instead. This transient table then uses
either those normal or output action rules. With this split, we will be
able to match egress/ingress flows in TRANSIENT table instead of
LOCAL_SWITCHING putting DVR pipeline in front of OVS firewall pipeline.

subject: Make req spec and RT aware of volume-backed instances
commit_message:
Make req spec and RT aware of volume-backed instances

Currently, the flavor disk size is used for scheduling and resource
reporting of instances regardless of whether an instance has been
booted from volume. This causes problems like instances filling up
a compute host's 'local_gb' and 'local_gb_used' when in reality,
they aren't using any local disk space if they are boot from volume.
This causes a scenario where the cluster has capacity but requests
fail to schedule because hosts are reporting disk used that isn't
actually used.

This makes the request spec request 0 disk if the instance is
booted from volume and makes the resource tracker report 0 disk if
the instance is booted from volume. There is some overhead as the
block device mappings must be looked up to determine whether or
not an instance is boot from volume, each resource update period.

It also makes sure not to pollute instances and instance_extra
records with root_gb=0 (instance.root_gb and instance.flavor.root_gb).
This seeks only to adjust scheduling/claims/reporting for boot
from volume instances and not alter how instance records themselves
are saved. Instance records should continue to reflect the flavor
from which they were booted.
Note that the request spec will be saved with root_gb=0, as the
requested disk resources for boot from volume instances are
actually zero.

Closes-Bug: #1469179

subject: Fix regression preventing reporting negative resources for overcommit
commit_message:
Fix regression preventing reporting negative resources for overcommit

In Nova prior to Ocata, the scheduler computes available resources for
a compute node, attempting to mirror the same calculation that happens
locally. It does this to determine if a new instance should fit on the
node. If overcommit is being used, some of these numbers can be negative.

In change 016b810f675b20e8ce78f4c82dc9c679c0162b7a we changed the
compute side to never report negative resources, which was an ironic-
specific fix for nodes that are offline. That, however, has been
corrected for ironic nodes in 047da6498dbb3af71bcb9e6d0e2c38aa23b06615.
Since the base change to the resource tracker has caused the scheduler
and compute to do different math, we need to revert it to avoid the
scheduler sending instances to nodes where it believes -NNN is the
lower limit (with overcommit), but the node is reporting zero.

This doesn't actually affect Ocata because of our use of the placement
engine. However, this code is still in master and needs to be backported.
This part of the change actually didn't even have a unit test, so
this patch adds one to validate that the resource tracker will
calculate and report negative resources.

subject: Preserve pre-existing port when attach interface fails
commit_message:
Preserve pre-existing port when attach interface fails

When attaching an network interface to a server, the REST API
takes one of three possible inputs:

1. network_id or
2. port_id or
3. requested_id and network_id

It is a failure to request both network_id and port_id.

And you can't specify port_id and requested_id because that
would violate the port/network constraint or fail #3 where
network_id is required if you specify requested_ip.

Given this, we know that in attach_interface if port_id is not
None, it's a pre-existing Neutron port that we didn't create
during allocate_port_for_instance.

We use this knowledge to tell deallocate_port_for_instance that
it should not delete the pre-existing port directly since we
don't have that information in the network info cache.

This change also fixes some misleading and just plain wrong

subject: Fix race between create subnet and port requests
commit_message:
Fix race between create subnet and port requests

When creating an IPv6 auto-address subnet for a network, ports can be
created or updated concurrently in the same network, before the subnet
creation concludes. In such a situation, an IpAddressAlreadyAllocated
exception may be raised, because the subnet create request attempts to
allocate auto addresses to the concurrently created or updated ports,
which have been already allocated by the port requests.

This patchset adds code to the IPAM to skip the attempt to assign the
auto address to ports if they already have received them.
